title: Ticket #6911: scitokens: starter leaks credential directories
description:
After running a few "hello world" jobs with SciTokens last night, I was surprised to see that the credential directories are still present this morning - around 8 hours after the jobs had exited successfully.

Since this is a root-level personal condor, the credmon is also trying to renew credentials in the starter-owned directories given that the semantics are to renew tokens for tokens matching the form $SEC_CREDENTIAL_DIRECTORY/*/*.use.

When we are in "OAuth mode",

  1. The starter should cleanup after itself
  2. The startd should cleanup after starters
  3. The starter should place this directory in a location the credmon isn't scanning.
remarks:
2019-Feb-09 08:18:12 by bbockelm:
Todd was incredulous that HTCondor would be doing this, so I spent a bit of time tracking this down.

First, when the starter decides renew / acquire credentials, it calls this:

https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/master/src/condor_starter.V6.1/jic_shadow.cpp#L2974

This calls a remote API to fetch the credentials and writes it into SEC_CREDENTIAL_DIRECTORY:

https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/master/src/condor_starter.V6.1/NTsenders.cpp#L2262

At this point, we have a directory created per job. There simply doesn't appear anything that deletes these directories.

NOTE 1: At no point does the starter log it is moving these credentials or creating the directory. Probably worth fixing.

NOTE 2: The directory creation is done unconditionally if CREDD_OAUTH_MODE is set to true, even if the job contains no credentials.

2019-Apr-09 15:39:43 by jpatton:
The first commit caused two regressions, which have been resolved by [56536] and [56537]:
  1. When reading the list of token names from the OAuthServicesNeeded attr in the job ad (introduced in #6891), the "*" was not being changed to "_", which resulted in the starter asking for the wrong filename.
  2. Tokens were being written in the sandbox as owner root (or condor) instead of the slot user, which resulted in preventing the slot user from reading their tokens.

These issues have been addressed, as well as a minor issue (starter tried to remove the leaky dirs this ticket addressed, even though they no longer exist).

2019-Apr-09 15:40:04 by jpatton:
CODE REVIEW: Looks good to me.
